6 - Marshall - 2001-2010 |- | '''Most Recent Game''' | Ohio 44-7 - (2011) |- | '''Last ten games''' | Marshall 8â2 |- |} The '''Battle for the Bell''' is an an American [[college football]] [[rivalry]] game played by the [[Marshall Thundering Herd football]] team of [[Marshall University]] and the [[Ohio Bobcats football]] team of [[Ohio University]]. It is a regional rivalry, with the universities' campuses located about 80 miles (130 km) from each other, with a bell awarded as the trophy for the winner of the game. With Marshall's move from the [[Mid-American Conference]] to [[Conference USA]] in 2005, this rivalry game has been on hiatus. The series unexpectedly resumed in 2009 when the Herd and Bobcats faced off in the [[2009 Little Caesars Pizza Bowl]], which [[2009 Marshall Thundering Herd football team|Marshall]] won 21â17. A six-year contract between the schools began in 2010, with Ohio taking the 2011 contest 44â7. This most recent win by Ohio snapped a six-game winning streak by Marshall.
